page.title: 12SHOPS IN LIMPSFIELD
page.content: { Memorial Stores}is a general store which replaced a memorial barn dedicated to the people of{Limpsfield} who fell in the{First World War.} The{Lithographers}and{Printing Press} was a carpenter's until 1959 but in 1800 it was a stable which served as a facility for journeys between London and Maidstone. The{Wine Shop}was originally Wickham's (a grocers) and became Cullens until 1980. The{Bakery}has always been a bakery. The{Bookshop,}known since 1945, was a haberdashers and later a grocers. The{Interior decorators}was previously an ironmongers. The{Jewellry Shop}was an architects studio, then a Parish Council office. Before 1970{Ebbutt's Funeral Service} was a combined builders and funeral directors.
